TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national . He was born in DATE and lives in PERSON do PERSON ( GPE ) . He presented his own case to the ORG . He is an auditor and lawyer . His name was temporarily removed from ORG roll by a decision of ORG of DATE , published in ORG on DATE , which considered the exercise of the profession of lawyer to be incompatible with that of auditor .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant was committed to stand trial at FAC for insulting a judge . The investigating judge officially assigned a lawyer to represent the applicant , contrary to the wishes of the latter , who stated , relying on LAW ( c ) of the LAW , that he wanted to defend himself .

The applicant therefore appealed against the committal order ( despacho de pronúncia ) to ORG ( Tribunal PERSON ) . The investigating judge declared the appeal inadmissible , however , on the ground that it had not been lodged by a lawyer and the applicant could not defend himself in person . The applicant lodged a complaint with the President of ORG , which was dismissed for the same reason .

The applicant then lodged a constitutional appeal with ORG ) . In an order of CARDINAL DATE the President of ORG stated that the issue raised by the applicant , namely the impossibility of defending himself , should be determined by ORG and , accordingly , ordered the appeal to be transmitted to that court .

On DATE the judge rapporteur at ORG , after noting that the applicant ’s name had been temporarily removed from ORG roll , asked him to instruct a lawyer pursuant to LAW . On DATE the applicant alleged that the relevant provision of that LAW was contrary to the LAW and asked for his appeal to be examined . In an order of CARDINAL DATE the judge rapporteur considered that the provision in question was not contrary to the LAW and again asked the applicant to instruct a lawyer , failing which ORG would refuse to examine his appeal . On DATE the applicant requested the matter to be submitted to a committee ( conferência ) of judges .

In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE the committee upheld the order complained of and pointed out that neither the relevant provision of LAW nor the similar provisions of LAW were contrary to LAW . ORG accordingly requested the applicant to instruct a lawyer .

In the meantime the ORG had fixed a hearing for DATE . The applicant maintained that at the start of the hearing he had requested leave to defend himself , which the court had refused . He had then been assigned a lawyer by the court .

In a judgment of DATE the court convicted the applicant and sentenced him to CARDINAL day - fines . The applicant was also ordered to pay CARDINAL NORP escudos ( PTE ) in damages to the assistente ( the judge he had insulted ) .

The applicant appealed against that judgment , but the judge , considering that his appeal was merely a statement within the meaning of LAW , decided not to transmit it to ORG . A complaint submitted by the applicant was treated in the same way in an order of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the judge of ORG , considering that the ORG Law no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE should be applied in the present case , declared that the sentence imposed on the applicant ( and not yet enforced ) was void . However , on DATE the applicant learned that the prosecution had instituted enforcement proceedings for the sum payable to the assistente in damages .
Following a request by the applicant in that regard , the judge rapporteur at ORG also declared , on DATE , that the proceedings still pending before that court had terminated .

Under Articles CARDINAL , DATE and CARDINAL of LAW , defence counsel exercises the accused ’s statutory rights . In certain cases , particularly as regards presence at hearings and the lodging of applications , it is compulsory to instruct counsel . If the accused does not appoint a lawyer , the judge must officially assign CARDINAL .

According to the established case - law of ORG , a defendant in criminal proceedings can not represent himself in person even if he is a lawyer or judge . ORG considers that the statutory provisions authorising judges and lawyers to act in person before the courts are inapplicable in criminal cases ( judgment of DATE , Boletim do PERSON no . CARDINAL , p. CARDINAL ) .
